comment: Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. Used as the abstract class for JsonGetterConverter and JsonSetterConverter.
commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. Used as the abstract class for JsonGetterConverter and JsonSetterConverter.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
commenthtml: Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. Used as the abstract class for JsonGetterConverter and JsonSetterConverter.
inlinecomment: ' Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. Used as the abstract class for JsonGetterConverter and JsonSetterConverter.

methods.label: withCustomConverter
methods.comment: Passes a custom converter to this AbstractJsonFunctionConverter. The converter will be used to convert the relevant label to a VoltScript object rather than a scalar or scalar array.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Run a class&apos;s setName(firstName, lastName) function, but convert last name to upper case before passing it in.
%END REM
Dim converter as New JsonSetterConverter
Dim upperCaseConverter as New ConvertToUCaseConverter()
Call converter.forSetter(&quot;setName&quot;).withValueParam().withSiblingParam(&quot;lastName&quot;)
Call converter.withCustomConverter(&quot;lastName&quot;, upperCaseConverter)
methods.signature: Public Function withCustomConverter(labelName As String, converter As AbstractJsonConverter) As Variant
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Passes a custom converter to this AbstractJsonFunctionConverter. The converter will be used to convert the relevant label to a VoltScript object rather than a scalar or scalar array.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Passes a custom converter to this AbstractJsonFunctionConverter. The converter will be used to convert the relevant label to a VoltScript object rather than a scalar or scalar array.
methods.inlinecomment: ' Passes a custom converter to this AbstractJsonFunctionConverter. The converter will be used to convert the relevant label to a VoltScript object rather than a scalar or scalar array.
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM<br />Run a class&apos;s setName(firstName, lastName) function, but convert last name to upper case before passing it in.<br />%END REM<br />Dim converter as New JsonSetterConverter<br />Dim upperCaseConverter as New ConvertToUCaseConverter()<br />Call converter.forSetter(&quot;setName&quot;).withValueParam().withSiblingParam(&quot;lastName&quot;)<br />Call converter.withCustomConverter(&quot;lastName&quot;, upperCaseConverter)

methods.label: withLiteralParam
methods.comment: Fluent method to pass a literal value as a parameter for the converter
methods.codesample:
%REM
Ensures that when extracting the gender element from a JSON object, the target class&apos;s setGender method is called with the literal value &quot;M&quot;. 
This is found in the CustomSetterTest sample, a hard-coded test for validation purposes only.
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim genderConverter as New JsonSetterConverter()
Call genderConverter.forSetter(setGender).withLiteralParam(&quot;M&quot;)
Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;gender&quot;, genderConverter)
methods.signature: Public Function withLiteralParam(paramVal As Variant) As AbstractJsonFunctionConverter
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Fluent method to pass a literal value as a parameter for the converter</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
